p: For mustard, the microgreens’ EO composition was mainly rich in phytol, closely followed by allyl isothiocyanate. The latter is characterized by a bitter, pungent, and sulfur-like aroma, very similar to that of the third most abundant compound, 3-butenyl isothiocyanate, which is described as wasabi-like [ 24]. The significant presence of allyl isothiocyanate in mustard’s EO is in accordance with the published studies on adult mustard plants from China [ 59] and Korea [ 60].
